reviews.review: It's a fantastic game. The basic storyline is great. The only downside is that the game is too short, it should have been longer. I would rate a 8/10. :)

Portal 1 is a great game. The graphics are nothing special, but they do not hinder the gameplay in any way. The most important thing to remember is to think outside the box, every testchamber has multiple solutions; and many challenges can be bipassed. Also the game has many comedic elements. all in al 10/10

Amazing, especially if you like kind of dystopic games as well as puzzle games. It is a very short game, but it is a very unique concept and without this we would never have the sequel, which features a much more detailed storyline as well as more varied areas.
One of the best games ever made. A must play or any PC gamer, and should be a mandatory part of every school curriculum.

Portal is a game about penetrating holes. You can use a device to force open holes where there weren't holes before, so you can penetrate them. Penetrating the holes will take you to an entirely new place, believe me. You can even penetrate multiple holes at the same time, this is called double penetration. A great thing about Portal is that you can go in and out of a hole repeatedly. You can also force objects into the holes, this is often used to reach the game's climactic finish. Overall, a great game for people of all ages who are curious about penetration.
Great game!

- Amazing Portal mechanic baffles and blows the minds of every player.
- Sarcastic, clever humor that appears throughout game keeps it interesting.
- Satisfying ending, (No spoilers here, but everyone knows what the cake is by now.)
- OH MY GOD I LOVE THIS GAME
- Runs quite easily.

[Detailreiches Review] Ein Klassiker den ich viel zu spät fand..

Ich möchte vorweg sagen: Ich hielt nie von Portal!
Fand es immer Uninteressant bis ich "Portal 2" geschenkt bekam, also teste ich es mal aus (wäre ja sonst Verschwendung gewesen) und ich habe spätestens nach dem Kennenlernen von GLaDOS bemerkt, das ich dieses Spiel liebe. Also wundert es warscheinlich niemand das ich auch "Portal" kaufte. Zu diesem möchte ich nun etwas schreiben (Review zu Portal 2 kommt auch im laufe des Tages).

-> Kapitel 1: Aufgaben
Aufgrund meines Wissens von "Portal 2" war Portal für mich nach rund 30-40 Minuten vorbei, ich empfand Portal im vergleich eher als "Tutorial", jedoch hätte ich ohne mein Vorwissen auch länger gebraucht. Die Aufgaben sind ziemlich gut gestellt und es gibt mir keine bekannten Fehler oder Bugs.

-> Kapitel 2: Geschichte
Ist hier eher Mau gehalten, im Grunde erfährt man via "Portal 2" eigentlich die gesamte Lebensgeschichte die man dazu Wissen möchte über Chell (Spieler), GLaDOS und dem Firmendirektor.

-> Kapitel 3: Grafik und Ton
Die Grafik ist etwas älter aber nicht störend da man sich in das Spiel verliebt und die Grafik da nicht ganz beachtet, dennoch wird man, sobald man "Portal 2" spielt merken: Da wurde zu 120% verbessert!
Ich nehme hier auch noch Ton dazu denn ich möchte euch unbedingt etwas Raten! Bitte nimmt die Englischen Stimmen und wählt Untertitel aus, die originale Stimme von GLaDOS ist wirklich ziemlich Awesome!

-> Endmeinung:
"Portal" ist der perfekte Anfang um mit "Portal 2" weiter zu machen, zudem ist dieses Spiel wirklich sehr Günstig für das was man bekommt. Ich bereue es nicht früher beide "Portal" Teile gespielt zu haben..

If you like clever, original games and would like to challenge yourself a bit, Portal is a game for you.

Despite its short yet reasonable length, Portal surprisingly has a complex, well-thought story. It's no suprising because this game is set in the Half-Life universe.

This game is also surprisingly funny with its quirky yet dark humor. If that's your kind of humor, you'll love this game.

Portal!!
After the game's got so much critical acclaim, seems like there's not much to add, only to ask myself how didn't I play it sooner.

I would start then with a very short list of the things that DID bother me,
First, well, the length of course. Nothing new here. I do believe it simply wasn't meant to be too long in the first place but more like a side content to The Orange Box back in the day, but still.
Also, soundtrack was a little disappointing in my opinion.
And, before completing the main game, I've seen that there are "challenges" and "advanced maps", and imagined that they would add more content to the game, but figured out later that these are merely a revisions of the original maps from the campaign.

So, just let me confess here, that Portal didn't completely live up to my expectations. (~Hiding myself from possibly thrown objects~)
As this game is so positively accepted I did expect something more.
Being so short and the lack of additional content in the base game didn't help much.
It was fun but ended too soon, and the story just felt... meeeh.
And the challenges started to feel too crazy for me as soon as they started depending on trial&error\some luck, facts which I don't like!

I did grow a lot fonder of Portal as I played through the developers commentary.
Hearing their thoughts and the game-making process made me appreciate everything much more, somehow.
I even liked better that "Still Alive" song which at first seemed bizzare and weird to me.

Anyway, I'm not going to fully review this game and describe all of it's good aspects, because you probably know them already, and if not (!?) then you should experience it yourself, even by trying the demo.
Just wanted to share my little story of falling in love with the game.

Portal is without a doubt a very extraordinary puzzle game, brilliantly original, and I doubt we'll ever see any other game of the kind. Many other games tried to follow Portal's lead and so far I didn't encounter much success among these attempts.

It goes constantly on sale, and it's actually worth the full price of 10$ as well.
If you didn't already, it's time to play!

Portal is a very different game indeed. There is no combat involved, but the puzzles and story definitely make up for this. The story makes sence with the portal mechanic, and you always want to know what happens next. Pick up Portal if you like rich stories or puzzle games. Just beware, the courses can be very tricky.

Yes Yes Yes. This is by far the best Valve Game Series in my opinion. The game is about a Test subject named Chell who was awakened by the comedian operating system GLaDOS. She wakes you up as you are the last test subject in a place called Aperture. Now Chell needs to get through all the test chambers to get her cake from GLaDOS, because apperantly she loves cake. This is a great classic and needs to cost more to me for the comedy. 9.5/10.
I LOVE this game. Haven't been this addicted to anything in a long time, well worth getting.

THIS GAME!...was my first experience with puzzle games...very straight & amazing
Your mission is not to find the exit...you know where the exit...your mission is to think to reach the exit
simply the game based on waking up your mind & thinking in different ways in different situations.
Story is too sad :( ...Ending (& after ending story...can find on wikis or search videos of the game) is more sad for the both of you & GLaDOS.
well..you finished the game..you think it's ordinary story? ..time to change your mind..go & play "Portal 2"..the greatest game I ever played in my life...with great story & great personality for every character (I won't say more than that..enough spoilers for today :v)

雖說主要是在解謎，但簡單來說
就只是想辦法一次又一次從房間的入口順利抵達出口
在配置好各種物件的場景內移動、跳躍、搬運物品、設置傳送門
能做的事非常單純，謎題的難度也適中
不過加上一些也很單純的物理效應後，所產生的變化就非比尋常了
隨著場景內要素的增加，呈現出來的關卡將超乎想像
角色間的互動方式也是有趣之處
主導了整體走向的核心角色，於最後獻上了美妙的歌曲
遊戲中創意的展現讓人十分享受
要說缺點大概就是劇情長度短了些
不滿足的話可以接著嘗試真正有難度的挑戰模式
